title: Runner boots

properties.name: description
properties.value: Runner boots are a member's only type of armour. To wear penance boots the player must have at least 40 Defence. The boots can be obtained by exchanging 100 Honour Points in each role from the Barbarian Assault minigame, and does not require the Penance Queen to be killed.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Runner boots
Runner boots
Released4 January 2007 (Update)
MembersYes
Quest itemNo
Properties
TradeableNo
EquipableYes
StackableNo
OptionsWear
DestroyDrop
ExamineBoots made from a Penance Runner.
Values
Value65,003 coins
AlchemyNot alchemisable
Weight0.34 kg
Advanced data
Item ID10552

Runner boots are a member's only type of armour. To wear penance boots the player must have at least 40 Defence. The boots can be obtained by exchanging 100 Honour Points in each role from the Barbarian Assault minigame, and does not require the Penance Queen to be killed.

The runner boots are not often used for combat purposes because of their poor stats. Runner boots provide a small attack bonus to magic (+1) and ranged (+1) but have defence bonuses similar to that of black boots, which only require 10 Defence. The boots also lack a strength bonus like that provided by climbing boots, rune boots, spiked manacles and dragon boots. The boots are often used instead to show prestige in Barbarian Assault.

 Attack bonuses
+0+0+0+1+1
 Defence bonuses
+8+8+8+0+0
 Other bonusesSlot

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
20 August –
2 October 2014

The "Destroy" option was replaced with a "Drop" option.

8 August 2013
(update)

Some feedback changes have been made to the config costs of the fire cape, rune defender and penance items, including the penance skirt.

2 August 2013
(update | poll)

The item's value was increased from 5,000 to 65,003 so it is protected over rune armour upon death.

22 February 2013
(update)

This content was included when the Old School RuneScape servers officially launched.

To wear penance boots the player must have at least 40 [[Defence]]. The boots can be obtained by exchanging 100 [[Honour Points]] in each role from the [[Barbarian Assault]] [[minigame]], and does not require the [[Penance Queen]] to be killed. The runner boots are not often used for combat purposes because of their poor stats. Runner boots provide a small attack bonus to magic (+1) and ranged (+1) but have defence bonuses similar to that of [[black boots]], which only require 10 Defence. The boots also lack a strength bonus like that provided by [[climbing boots]], [[rune boots]], [[spiked manacles]] and [[dragon boots]].
